verses.verse: Manasseh<WH4519> was twelve<WH8147> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> when he began to reign;<WH4427> and he reigned<WH4427> fifty<WH2572> - five<WH2568> years<WH8141> in Jerusalem.<WH3389>

He did<WH6213> that which was evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of Yahweh,<WH3068> after the abominations<WH8441> of the nations<WH1471> whom Yahweh<WH3068> cast out<WH3423> before<WH6440> the children<WH1121> of Israel.<WH3478>

For he built<WH1129> again<WH7725> the high places<WH1116> which Hezekiah<WH3169> his father<WH1> had broken down;<WH5422> and he reared up<WH6965> altars<WH4196> for the Baals,<WH1168> and made<WH6213> Asheroth,<WH842> and worshiped<WH7812> all the army<WH6635> of the sky,<WH8064> and served them.<WH5647>
He built<WH1129> altars<WH4196> in the house<WH1004> of Yahweh,<WH3068> of which Yahweh<WH3068> said,<WH559> "My name<WH8034> shall be in Jerusalem<WH3389> forever.<WH5769>"
He built<WH1129> altars<WH4196> for all the army<WH6635> of the sky<WH8064> in the two<WH8147> courts<WH2691> of the house<WH1004> of Yahweh.<WH3068>

He also made<WH5674> his children<WH1121> to pass through<WH5674> the fire<WH784> in the valley<WH1516> of the son<WH1121> of Hinnom;<WH2011> and he practiced sorcery,<WH6049> and used enchantments,<WH5172> and practiced sorcery,<WH3784> and dealt<WH6213> with those who had familiar spirits,<WH178> and with wizards:<WH3049> he worked<WH6213> much<WH7235> evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of Yahweh,<WH3068> to provoke him to anger.<WH3707>

He set<WH7760> the engraved image<WH6459> of the idol,<WH5566> which he had made,<WH6213> in the house<WH1004> of God,<WH430> of which God<WH430> said<WH559> to David<WH1732> and to Solomon<WH8010> his son,<WH1121> "In this house,<WH1004> and in Jerusalem,<WH3389> which I have chosen<WH977> out of all the tribes<WH7626> of Israel,<WH3478> will I put<WH7760> my name<WH8034> forever:<WH5865>

neither will I any more<WH3254> remove<WH5493> the foot<WH7272> of Israel<WH3478> from off the land<WH127> which I have appointed<WH5975> for your fathers,<WH1> if<WH518> only they will observe<WH8104> to do<WH6213> all that<WH518> I have commanded<WH6680> them,<WH8451> even all the law and the statutes<WH2706> and the ordinances<WH4941> given by<WH3027> Moses.<WH4872>"

Manasseh<WH4519> seduced<WH8582> Judah<WH3063> and the inhabitants<WH3427> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> so that they did<WH6213> more<WH7451> evil<WH8582> than the nations<WH1471> whom Yahweh<WH3068> destroyed<WH8045> before<WH6440> the children<WH1121> of Israel did.<WH3478>
Yahweh<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> to Manasseh,<WH4519> and to his people;<WH5971> but they gave no heed.<WH7181>

Therefore Yahweh<WH3068> brought<WH935> on them the captains of<WH8269> the army of<WH8269> the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> who took<WH3920> Manasseh<WH4519> in chains,<WH631> and bound him with fetters,<WH5178> and carried<WH3212> him<WH631> to Babylon.<WH894>
When he was in distress,<WH6887> he begged<WH2470> Yahweh<WH3068> his God,<WH430> and humbled<WH3665> himself greatly<WH3966> before<WH6440> the God<WH430> of his fathers.<WH1>

He prayed<WH6419> to him;<WH6279> and he was entreated by him,<WH8085> and heard his supplication,<WH8467> and brought him again<WH7725> to Jerusalem<WH3389> into his kingdom.<WH4438> Then Manasseh<WH4519> knew<WH3045> that Yahweh<WH3068> was God.<WH430>

Now after this<WH310> he built<WH1129> an outer wall<WH2346> to the city<WH5892> of David,<WH1732> on the west side<WH4628> of Gihon,<WH1521> in<WH935> the valley,<WH5158> even to the entrance<WH935> at the fish<WH1709> gate;<WH8179> and he encircled<WH5437> Ophel<WH6077> with it,<WH1361> and raised it up to a very great height:<WH3966> and he put<WH7760> valiant<WH2428> captains<WH8269> in all the fortified<WH1219> cities<WH5892> of Judah.<WH3063>

He took away<WH5493> the foreign<WH5236> gods,<WH430> and the idol<WH5566> out of the house<WH1004> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and all the altars<WH4196> that he had built<WH1129> in the mountain<WH2022> of the house<WH1004> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and in Jerusalem,<WH3389> and cast<WH7993> them out<WH2351> of the city.<WH5892>

He built<WH1129> up the altar<WH4196> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and offered<WH2076> thereon sacrifices of peace<WH8002> offerings<WH2077> and of thanksgiving,<WH8426> and commanded<WH559> Judah<WH3063> to serve<WH5647> Yahweh,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel.<WH3478>
Nevertheless<WH61> the people<WH5971> sacrificed<WH2076> still in the high places,<WH1116> but only to Yahweh<WH3068> their God.<WH430>

Now the rest<WH3499> of the acts<WH1697> of Manasseh,<WH4519> and his prayer<WH8605> to his God,<WH430> and the words<WH1697> of the seers<WH2374> who spoke<WH1696> to him in the name<WH8034> of Yahweh,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> behold,<WH1697> they are written among the acts of the kings<WH4428> of Israel.<WH3478>

His prayer<WH8605> also,<WH6279> and how God was entreated of him,<WH2403> and all his sin and his trespass,<WH4604> and the places<WH4725> in which he built<WH1129> high places,<WH1116> and set up<WH5975> the Asherim<WH842> and the engraved images,<WH6456> before<WH6440> he humbled<WH3665> himself:<WH3789> behold, they are written in the history<WH1697> of Hozai.<WH2374>
So Manasseh<WH4519> slept<WH7901> with his fathers,<WH1> and they buried<WH6912> him in his own house:<WH1004> and Amon<WH526> his son<WH1121> reigned in his place.<WH4427>
Amon<WH526> was twenty<WH6242> - two<WH8147> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> when he began to reign;<WH4427> and he reigned<WH4427> two<WH8147> years<WH8141> in Jerusalem.<WH3389>

He did<WH6213> that which was evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of Yahweh,<WH3068> as did<WH6213> Manasseh<WH4519> his father;<WH1> and Amon<WH526> sacrificed<WH2076> to all the engraved images<WH6456> which Manasseh<WH4519> his father<WH1> had made,<WH6213> and served them.<WH5647>
He didn't<WH6440> humble himself before Yahweh,<WH3068> as Manasseh<WH4519> his father<WH1> had humbled<WH3665> himself;<WH526> but this same Amon trespassed<WH819> more<WH7235> and more.<WH7235>
His servants<WH5650> conspired<WH7194> against him,<WH4191> and put him to death in his own house.<WH1004>

But the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776> killed<WH5221> all those who had conspired<WH7194> against king<WH4428> Amon;<WH526> and the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776> made<WH4427> Josiah<WH2977> his son<WH1121> king in his place.<WH4427>
